tasks.title: Update design system documentation and code implementation to meet shadcn/ui standards
tasks.description: Enhance the design system with proper text overflow handling, comprehensive component state management, button component consolidation, accessibility improvements, and updated documentation to align with shadcn/ui standards.
tasks.details: 1. **Text Overflow Handling Implementation** - Add CSS utilities for text truncation: ```css .truncate { overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis; white-space: nowrap; } .line-clamp-2 { overflow: hidden; display: -webkit-box; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; } ``` - Create tooltip wrapper component for truncated text - Apply ellipsis to all button variants and text components 2. **Component State Management** - Implement loading states: ```tsx interface ButtonProps { loading?: boolean; disabled?: boolean; } const Button = ({ loading, children, ...props }) => ( ); ``` - Create skeleton loader components for cards, lists, and tables - Add error and pending state variants for form inputs 3. **Button Component Consolidation** - Merge duplicate button implementations into single component - Support variants: default, destructive, outline, secondary, ghost, link - Add icon positioning: left, right, icon-only - Implement size variants: sm, default, lg - Ensure proper text overflow with max-width constraints 4. **Accessibility Enhancements** - Add aria-label, aria-describedby, aria-busy for loading states - Implement roving tabindex for button groups - Add focus-visible styles and skip links - Test with screen readers and high contrast mode - Ensure WCAG 2.1 AA compliance 5. **Documentation Structure** - Update DESIGN_SYSTEM.md sections: - Text Handling Guidelines (overflow, truncation, wrapping) - Component States (loading, error, disabled, hover, focus) - Responsive Patterns (breakpoints, scaling, touch targets) - Accessibility Standards - Add code examples for each pattern - Include visual examples and edge cases 6. **Theme Integration** - Convert hardcoded colors to CSS variables - Update Qt stylesheets to use theme variables: ```css QPushButton { background-color: var(--primary); color: var(--primary-foreground); } ``` - Ensure dark mode compatibility - Add theme-aware hover and focus states
tasks.testStrategy:
1. **Text Overflow Testing**
   - Create buttons with very long text content
   - Verify ellipsis appears and tooltips show full text
   - Test in different container widths
   - Check RTL language support

2. **State Management Verification**
   - Test loading state animations and disabled interactions
   - Verify skeleton loaders match component dimensions
   - Test state transitions (normal â†’ loading â†’ error/success)
   - Ensure form submission is blocked during loading

3. **Button Component Testing**
   - Verify all variants render correctly
   - Test icon + text combinations in all positions
   - Check keyboard navigation between buttons
   - Test click handlers during loading state

4. **Accessibility Audit**
   - Run axe-core automated tests
   - Test with NVDA/JAWS screen readers
   - Verify keyboard-only navigation
   - Test in Windows High Contrast mode
   - Check color contrast ratios (4.5:1 minimum)

5. **Documentation Review**
   - Verify all code examples work correctly
   - Check that guidelines cover common use cases
   - Ensure examples follow the documented patterns
   - Test copy-paste functionality of code blocks

6. **Theme Testing**
   - Toggle between light/dark modes
   - Verify CSS variables update correctly
   - Test Qt stylesheet theme integration
   - Check custom theme color application

subtasks.title: Implement CSS utilities for text overflow handling
subtasks.description: Create and integrate CSS utility classes for text truncation including single-line ellipsis and multi-line clamping
subtasks.details:
Add .truncate class with overflow:hidden, text-overflow:ellipsis, white-space:nowrap properties. Implement .line-clamp-{n} utilities using -webkit-line-clamp for 2,3,4 line variants. Create responsive variants like .sm:truncate. Add these utilities to the global CSS file or Tailwind config if using Tailwind.

subtasks.testStrategy: Create test components with various text lengths to verify truncation works correctly. Test in different browsers for webkit compatibility. Verify responsive breakpoints apply truncation appropriately.

subtasks.title: Create tooltip wrapper component for truncated text
subtasks.description: Build a React component that automatically shows tooltips when text is truncated or overflowing
subtasks.details:
Implement TruncatedText component that detects overflow using scrollWidth > clientWidth. Use Radix UI Tooltip or similar for tooltip functionality. Component should accept maxWidth, lines props and children. Add ref forwarding and resize observer for dynamic content. Include hover delay and portal rendering.
<info added on 2025-06-28T08:40:06.026Z>
Task 17.2 completed successfully. Implemented comprehensive tooltip wrapper system in Qt/Python with TruncatedTextLabel class featuring automatic text truncation detection using QFontMetrics, single/multi-line text support, dynamic tooltip management (shows only when text is truncated), resize event handling for responsive behavior, 500ms tooltip delay, and ARIA accessibility support. Also created TooltipWrapper class for wrapping existing widgets, factory functions for easy component creation, and integrated all components into the module system. Implementation follows shadcn/ui patterns with theme manager integration and signal/slot system for truncation state notifications.
</info added on 2025-06-28T08:40:06.026Z>

subtasks.title: Implement skeleton loader components

<info added on 2025-06-28T08:44:04.812Z>

Implemented comprehensive Skeleton loader component system with BaseSkeleton class featuring 3 animation types (PULSE, WAVE, SHIMMER) and 3 shapes (RECTANGLE, CIRCLE, ROUNDED). Built Qt PropertyAnimation system with smooth cinematic easing curves and infinite loop animations. Created factory functions for skeleton variants: text, card, table, and list. Integrated with ThemeManager for dynamic theming and light/dark mode support. Added accessibility attributes and registered components in module init. Component follows shadcn/ui patterns with performance-optimized custom painting for gradient effects.

<info added on 2025-06-28T09:20:59.384Z>
DESIGN_SYSTEM.md documentation has been completely updated with comprehensive sections including Table of Contents, Text Handling Guidelines with overflow strategies, Component States covering loading and error patterns, Responsive Patterns for breakpoints and touch targets, Accessibility Standards with ARIA and focus management, 3-Mode Compatibility for DEV/DUAL/GUI modes, and Migration Guide. All new components are fully documented: BaseButton with loading states and icon support, BaseCard with clickable features and keyboard navigation, BaseInput with pending states and spinner, BaseSelect and BaseTextarea as new components, SkeletonLoader with detailed implementation, and TooltipWrapper. Comprehensive code examples include usage patterns for each component, factory method utilization, complete form implementations, and responsive dashboard examples. Accessibility features cover ARIA implementation, keyboard navigation, screen reader support, and full 3-mode compatibility ensuring developers can easily understand and implement the new design system.

tasks.details:
**1. ì´ë¯¸ì§€ í•„í„°ë§ ê¸°ëŠ¥ êµ¬í˜„**
- **Gaussian Blur Filter**
  ```python
  def apply_gaussian_blur(image, sigma=1.0):
      return cv2.GaussianBlur(image, (0, 0), sigma)
  ```
- **Median Filter** (ë…¸ì´ì¦ˆ ì œê±°ì— íš¨ê³¼ì )
  ```python
  def apply_median_filter(image, kernel_size=5):
      return cv2.medianBlur(image, kernel_size)
  ```
- **Bilateral Filter** (ì—£ì§€ ë³´ì¡´í•˜ë©° ë…¸ì´ì¦ˆ ì œê±°)
  ```python
  def apply_bilateral_filter(image, d=9, sigma_color=75, sigma_space=75):
      return cv2.bilateralFilter(image, d, sigma_color, sigma_space)
  ```
- **Morphological Operations**
  - Erosion, Dilation, Opening, Closing
  - Top-hat, Black-hat ë³€í™˜

**2. ë…¸ì´ì¦ˆ ì œê±° ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜**
- **Non-local Means Denoising**
  ```python
  def denoise_nlmeans(image, h=10, template_window_size=7, search_window_size=21):
      return cv2.fastNlMeansDenoisingColored(image, None, h, h, template_window_size, search_window_size)
  ```
- **Wavelet Denoising**
  ```python
  def wavelet_denoise(image, wavelet='db4', level=5):
      coeffs = pywt.wavedec2(image, wavelet, level=level)
      threshold = estimate_noise_level(coeffs)
      coeffs_thresh = soft_threshold(coeffs, threshold)
      return pywt.waverec2(coeffs_thresh, wavelet)
  ```
- **BM3D (Block-Matching and 3D filtering)**
- **Wiener Filter** (ì£¼íŒŒìˆ˜ ë„ë©”ì¸ í•„í„°ë§)

**3. ìë™ ëŒ€ë¹„ ì¡°ì • ê¸°ëŠ¥**
- **Histogram Equalization**
  ```python
  def apply_histogram_equalization(image):
      if len(image.shape) == 2:
          return cv2.equalizeHist(image)
      else:
          ycrcb = cv2.cvtColor(image, cv2.COLOR_BGR2YCrCb)
          ycrcb[:,:,0] = cv2.equalizeHist(ycrcb[:,:,0])
          return cv2.cvtColor(ycrcb, cv2.COLOR_YCrCb2BGR)
  ```
- **CLAHE (Contrast Limited Adaptive Histogram Equalization)**
  ```python
  def apply_clahe(image, clip_limit=2.0, tile_grid_size=(8,8)):
      clahe = cv2.createCLAHE(clipLimit=clip_limit, tileGridSize=tile_grid_size)
      if len(image.shape) == 2:
          return clahe.apply(image)
      else:
          lab = cv2.cvtColor(image, cv2.COLOR_BGR2LAB)
          lab[:,:,0] = clahe.apply(lab[:,:,0])
          return cv2.cvtColor(lab, cv2.COLOR_LAB2BGR)
  ```

  ```python
  from ultralytics import YOLO
  import torch
  
  class CellDetector:
      def __init__(self, model_path='models/cell_yolov8.pt'):
          self.model = YOLO(model_path)
          self.device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
          
      def detect_cells(self, image, conf_threshold=0.5):
          results = self.model(image, conf=conf_threshold)
          detections = []
          for r in results:
              boxes = r.boxes
              for box in boxes:
                  x1, y1, x2, y2 = box.xyxy[0]
                  conf = box.conf[0]
                  detections.append({
                      'bbox': [x1, y1, x2, y2],
                      'confidence': conf

          return detections
  ```

  ```python
  import cv2
  from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
  from skimage.measure import regionprops
  
  class MorphologicalClassifier:
      def __init__(self):
          self.classifier = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100)
          self.feature_names = ['area', 'perimeter', 'eccentricity', 
                               'solidity', 'circularity', 'aspect_ratio']
          
      def extract_features(self, mask, image):
          props = regionprops(mask.astype(int), intensity_image=image)[0]
          features = [
              props.area,
              props.perimeter,
              props.eccentricity,
              props.solidity,
              4 * np.pi * props.area / (props.perimeter ** 2),  # circularity
              props.major_axis_length / props.minor_axis_length  # aspect ratio
          ]
          return np.array(features)
          
      def classify_cell_type(self, features):
          # Classes: normal, elongated, circular, irregular
          prediction = self.classifier.predict([features])[0]
          probability = self.classifier.predict_proba([features])[0]
          return prediction, probability
  ```

- **Deep Learning ê¸°ë°˜ í˜•íƒœ ë¶„ë¥˜**

  ```python
  import torch.nn as nn
  
  class CellMorphologyNet(nn.Module):
      def __init__(self, num_classes=5):
          super().__init__()
          self.features = nn.Sequential(
              nn.Conv2d(3, 64, 3, padding=1),
              nn.ReLU(),
              nn.MaxPool2d(2),
              nn.Conv2d(64, 128, 3, padding=1),
              nn.ReLU(),
              nn.MaxPool2d(2),
              nn.Conv2d(128, 256, 3, padding=1),
              nn.ReLU(),
              nn.AdaptiveAvgPool2d(1)
          )
          self.classifier = nn.Linear(256, num_classes)
          
      def forward(self, x):
          x = self.features(x)
          x = x.view(x.size(0), -1)
          return self.classifier(x)
  ```

  ```python
  from sklearn.ensemble import IsolationForest
  from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
  
  class AbnormalCellDetector:
      def __init__(self, contamination=0.1):
          self.detector = IsolationForest(contamination=contamination)
          self.scaler = StandardScaler()
          
      def train(self, normal_cell_features):
          scaled_features = self.scaler.fit_transform(normal_cell_features)
          self.detector.fit(scaled_features)
          
      def detect_abnormal(self, cell_features):
          scaled_features = self.scaler.transform([cell_features])
          prediction = self.detector.predict(scaled_features)
          score = self.detector.decision_function(scaled_features)
          return prediction[0] == -1, score[0]
  ```

```python
class CellAnalysisAI:
    def __init__(self):
        self.detector = CellDetector()
        self.segmenter = CellSegmenter()
        self.classifier = MorphologicalClassifier()
        self.abnormal_detector = AbnormalCellDetector()
        
    def analyze_image(self, image):
        # 1. ì„¸í¬ ê²€ì¶œ
        detections = self.detector.detect_cells(image)
        
        # 2. ì„¸í¬ ì„¸ê·¸ë©˜í…Œì´ì…˜
        masks = self.segmenter.segment_cells(image)
        
        results = []
        for i, (detection, mask) in enumerate(zip(detections, masks)):
            # 3. íŠ¹ì§• ì¶”ì¶œ
            features = self.classifier.extract_features(mask, image)
            
            # 4. ì„¸í¬ íƒ€ì… ë¶„ë¥˜
            cell_type, confidence = self.classifier.classify_cell_type(features)
            
            # 5. ì´ìƒ ì„¸í¬ ê²€ì¶œ
            is_abnormal, abnormality_score = self.abnormal_detector.detect_abnormal(features)
            
            results.append({
                'id': i,
                'bbox': detection['bbox'],
                'mask': mask,
                'cell_type': cell_type,
                'confidence': confidence,
                'is_abnormal': is_abnormal,
                'abnormality_score': abnormality_score,
                'features': features
            })
            
        return results
```

```python
class ModelTrainer:
    def __init__(self, model, dataset):
        self.model = model
        self.dataset = dataset
        self.optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters(), lr=0.001)
        self.criterion = nn.CrossEntropyLoss()
        
    def train_epoch(self):
        self.model.train()
        total_loss = 0
        for batch in self.dataset:
            images, labels = batch
            self.optimizer.zero_grad()
            outputs = self.model(images)
            loss = self.criterion(outputs, labels)
            loss.backward()
            self.optimizer.step()
            total_loss += loss.item()
        return total_loss / len(self.dataset)
        
    def fine_tune_on_user_data(self, user_annotations):
        # ì‚¬ìš©ì ì£¼ì„ ë°ì´í„°ë¡œ ëª¨ë¸ ë¯¸ì„¸ ì¡°ì •

            loss = self.train_epoch()
            print(f'Fine-tuning epoch {epoch}: Loss = {loss:.4f}')
```

  ```python
  def evaluate_detection_model(model, test_dataset):
      tp, fp, fn = 0, 0, 0
      for image, ground_truth in test_dataset:
          predictions = model.detect_cells(image)
          matched = match_predictions_to_ground_truth(predictions, ground_truth)
          tp += len(matched)
          fp += len(predictions) - len(matched)
          fn += len(ground_truth) - len(matched)
      precision = tp / (tp + fp)
      recall = tp / (tp + fn)
      f1 = 2 * precision * recall / (precision + recall)
      return precision, recall, f1
  ```

  ```python
  class DataQualityValidator:
      def validate_completeness(self, dataset):
          missing_values = dataset.isnull().sum()
          completeness_score = (1 - missing_values / len(dataset)) * 100
          
          return {
              'missing_values': missing_values.to_dict(),
              'completeness_score': completeness_score.to_dict(),
  ```

  ```python
  def detect_outliers(self, data, method='iqr', threshold=1.5):
      if method == 'iqr':
          Q1 = data.quantile(0.25)
          Q3 = data.quantile(0.75)
          IQR = Q3 - Q1
          outliers = (data < (Q1 - threshold * IQR)) | (data > (Q3 + threshold * IQR))
      elif method == 'zscore':
          z_scores = np.abs(scipy.stats.zscore(data))
          outliers = z_scores > threshold
      
      return {
          'outlier_indices': np.where(outliers)[0].tolist(),
          'outlier_count': outliers.sum(),
          'outlier_percentage': (outliers.sum() / len(data)) * 100
      }
  ```
